intro: Eriocaulon gujanense, commonly known as the Gujanense flat sedge, is a member of the Poaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its flowering structures are usually inconspicuous, with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Eriocaulon gujanense is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
